page.title: 08Witherley Church Restoration
page.content:
St Peter's Church has been standing in Witherley for 500 years. The spire is 156 feet high, and was built in about 1350. It has a weathercock on the top.
In 1924 the spire was struck by lightning, and it caved in through the roof of the church. The Duke of York happened to pass by Witherley, and when he saw the damage that the lightning had done to the spire he gave a donation towards its repair.
In 1985 the church needs repairing again. When Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother (widow of the same Duke of York who later became King George VI) heard of this, she also gave a donation to the Restoration Fund.
